channel.title: Compiler error?!? PLEASE HELP ME!
channel.description:
I am using mod tarohks compiler. It says..
client.java:14537 ';' expected addItem(352, 1500) (lil triangle thingy pointing up here)
I tried adding the ; and removing the; and removing the whole starter but gives me the same god damn error.

item.title: Compiler error?!? PLEASE HELP ME!
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Post it here please. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,349078.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler error?!? PLEASE HELP ME!
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

[quote=“superpersonxd, post:5, topic:295083”][quote author=eagledude4 link=topic=390194.msg2913121#msg2913121 date=1250221090]
Alot of the times I face the same scenario, is because I didnt save the changes.
Save the changes, and reopen the compiler.
[/quote]
even still it is and I made sure. The file itself looks like this…

    if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {	
        if (starter == 0) {
            addItem(995, 15000000);
            addItem(392, 1500);

and It still gives me the error it’s really confusing me.[/quote]

I took my starter command out, Just add those items to the playerhandler so they get the items when they first create their character.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler error?!? PLEASE HELP ME!
item.dc:creator: @superpersonxd superpersonxd
item.description:
@superpersonxd wrote:

[quote=“eagledude4, post:4, topic:295083”]Alot of the times I face the same scenario, is because I didnt save the changes.
Save the changes, and reopen the compiler.[/quote]
even still it is and I made sure. The file itself looks like this…

            addItem(995, 15000000);
            addItem(392, 1500);            <-- I tried removing that whole thing, with the ; without it aswell. Idk why.

and It still gives me the error it’s really confusing me.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler error?!? PLEASE HELP ME!
item.dc:creator: @superpersonxd superpersonxd
item.description:
@superpersonxd wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:2, topic:295083”]It’s suppost to be,

addItem(YourId, Amount);

just press ctrl + g and go to the line the error is on.

here’s the basic started command,

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("Starter") { addItem(995, 10); }[/quote]

that’s what mine looks like, still giving me the error.

Read full topic
